2.text: Sift the powdered sugar into a bowl.

4.text: Combine lemon juice and egg whites and mix briefly with a wire whisk.

5.text: In a stand mixer, combine the lemon juice and egg white mixture with the sugar, adding the sugar a little at a time.

6.text: For icing to be used as piping, mix the royal icing until soft peaks begin forming.

7.text: Continue mixing and adding sugar, 2 teaspoons at a time, for firmer peaks.

8.text: Adjust as necessary with sugar, water, or egg whites.

9.text: Use royal icing immediately or transfer to an airtight container.

11.text: Check the label on your meringue powder.

12.text: In a stand- or electric mixer, beat the sugar and meringue powder on low until fully combined.

13.text: Add warm water and beat on medium or high until icing becomes glossy and peaks begin to form.

14.text: Adjust with more powdered sugar or water as needed.

15.text: Use royal icing immediately or transfer to an airtight container.

18.text: Add the confectioners sugar to a medium mixing bowl.

19.text: Stir the ingredients together until a smooth paste forms.

20.text: Pour in the corn syrup and vanilla extract.

21.text: If adding food coloring, remove even amounts from the bowl.

22.text: Use the royal icing straight away.
